question: 45 year old San Diegan teacher with 1 month history of bizarre ideation The most likely etiology of this process is: <image 1>
options: ['Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease', 'Amebic encephalitis', 'Herpes Simplex encephalitis', 'Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML)', 'Subacute sclerosing Panencephalitis (SSPE)']
description: The image appears to be a histological section of brain tissue stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E). The tissue shows areas of demyelination and gliosis, characterized by pink-stained regions with scattered white spots and some irregularly shaped structures. There are also some areas that appear to be more densely packed with cells, suggesting active inflammation or cellular response. The overall appearance suggests a pathological process affecting the brain tissue.
